paper_abstract: Some new classes of Hamming metric Gray codes over Z(p)(n), where p is a prime and n is an integer power of 2, are described; then, how these Gray codes can be used to generate the maximum number of edge-disjoint Hamiltonian cycles in an n-dimensional generalized hypercube (GHC), Q(p)(n), is shown. For Q(p)(n), the number of edge-disjoint Hamiltonian cycles generated using these methods is n(p - 1)/2 which is the maximum possible since the degree of each node in Q(p)(n) is n(p - 1). In addition, for any integers p and n, p not necessarily a prime and n not necessarily a power of 2, how to generate the maximum number of edge-disjoint Hamiltonian cycles in Q(p)(n) is also described.
paper_title: Generalized Hypercubes: Edge-Disjoint Hamiltonian Cycles and Gray Codes
